newsitem.title: USA: Clinton may veto Mexico drug decertification.
newsitem.headline: Clinton may veto Mexico drug decertification.

text.p: President Bill Clinton may use his veto powers to block efforts in Congress to reverse his certification of Mexico's anti-drug efforts, the White House said on Wednesday.
"The president feels very strongly on the subject of decertification," White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry said, adding "that includes the possibility of a veto."

White House officials said they expected the House of Representatives to pass a resolution Thursday that would reverse Clinton's certification of Mexico's drug fighting efforts -- forcing the administration to focus on the Senate to back language more acceptable to Clinton.
"We look closely at what the Senate considers," McCurry told reporters, noting that "decertification would send a signal to the government of Mexico that could conceivably be interpreted negatively."
"The president had made quite clear his strong views on certification and that could be strong enough to include the possibility of a veto," McCurry told reporters.
Clinton planned to meet later Wednesday with a group of senators invited to the White House to discuss the certification issue.
